thread.title: I guess we have to talk about Tebow reporting to spring training
thread.title_full: I guess we have to talk about Tebow reporting to spring training

title: I guess we have to talk about Tebow reporting to spring training
text:
I guess we have to talk about Tebow reporting to spring training Breaking: Professional baseball player reports to spring training. — Steve Gardner (@SteveAGardner) February 27, 2017 
Tim Tebow reported to the Mets' sprig training in Port St. Lucie, Florida on Monday as a non-roster invitee. There's nothing especially interesting about this from a baseball perspective, as he has no real chance of making the major league club out of spring training – and probably not at any other point, either. The only real reason to care about this is because Tim Tebow is Tim Tebow . So here we are, caring about Tim Tebow . 
Tim Tebow's arrival to spring training was accompanied by a press conference, in which the Heisman Trophy winner laid out his goals for next few weeks. In case you were wondering, Tim Tebow was the only non-roster invitee whose arrival at spring training was accompanied by a press conference . 
"That’s my ultimate goal," Tebow said about playing in the majors . "But I’ve had so much fun training, pursuing it. I enjoy the process, and hopefully I’ll have a chance to (play in the major leagues) someday.’’ 
At least one Mets fan was ticked off to see Tebow get so much attention at the expense of MLB regulars. 
A fan standing behind me at #Mets game: "They have Tebow, but not Granderson. Are you kidding me?" pic.twitter.com/qJVJbaWxsW — Ken Davidoff (@KenDavidoff) February 26, 2017 Author
